kit101.turtle

Class Turtle

  • java.lang.Object
    • kit101.turtle.Turtle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    InteractiveTurtle

    public class Turtle
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Draws turtle graphics in a TurtleWorld.

    Example usage: 

     Turtle t;
 t = new Turtle();
 t.turn(45);
 t.move(100);
    See Also:
    TurtleWorld, TurtleApplet, TurtleWindow

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected double direction
      Direction (in degrees) the Turtle is pointing (0 is east).
      protected boolean down
      true when the pen is down.
      protected java.awt.Color pen
      Current pen colour.
      protected static TurtleWorld sharedWorld
      If a Turtle is created without a world, a default world is created and used by future Turtles too.
      protected double x
      Turtle's x position.
      protected double y
      Turtle's y position.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Turtle()
      Creates a new Turtle in a new, default world with dimensions 500 x 500.
      Turtle(TurtleWindow w)
      Creates a new Turtle in the given TurtleWindow's world.
      Turtle(TurtleWorld tw)
      Creates a new Turtle in the given TurtleWorld.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void center()
      Moves Turtle to the middle of its world without drawing a line.
      void clear()
      Clears all the drawing in the Turtle's world.
      java.lang.Object clone()
      Returns a clone of this Turtle.
      java.awt.Color getColor()
      Returns the currrent pen color
      double getDirection()
      Returns the Turtle's current direction (in degrees), where 0 corresponds to east, 90 to north, 180 to west and 270 to south.
      TurtleWorld getWorld()
      Returns this Turtle's world.
      double getX()
      Returns the Turtle's current x position.
      double getY()
      Returns the Turtle's current y position.
      boolean isDown()
      Returns true if the Turtle's pen is currently down, false otherwise.
      void move(double dist)
      Moves this Turtle the given distance in the direction it is facing.
      void moveTo(double x, double y)
      Moves Turtle to the position given by parameters; if the pen is down, the Turtle will draw a line as it goes.
      void origin()
      Moves Turtle to the position 0,0 of its world (generally the bottom left) without drawing a line.
      void penDown()
      Changes Turtle's pen to the down position (so a line will be drawn when it moves.
      void penUp()
      Changes Turtle's pen to the up position (so no line will be drawn when it moves.
      void setColor(java.awt.Color c)
      Sets the pen colour.
      void setPenDown(boolean down)
      Sets the Turtle's pen position.
      Turtle setWorld(TurtleWorld world)
      Sets the Turtle's world and returns a refeerence to this Turtle.
      void turn(double delta)
      Turns the Turtle anticlockwise by the given number of degrees.
      void turnTo(double deg)
      Turns Turtle to the given angle, where 0 corresponds to east, 90 to north, 180 west and 270 south.
      void wait(int ms)
      Pauses for number of milliseconds indicated by parameter.

    • Field Detail

      • sharedWorld

        protected static TurtleWorld sharedWorld
        If a Turtle is created without a world, a default world is created and used by future Turtles too.

      • direction

        protected double direction
        Direction (in degrees) the Turtle is pointing (0 is east).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Turtle

        public Turtle(TurtleWorld tw)
        Creates a new Turtle in the given TurtleWorld.

      • Turtle

        public Turtle()
        Creates a new Turtle in a new, default world with dimensions 500 x 500. The Turtle starts at the centre of the drawing area, facing east (direction 0), with its pen down.

      • Turtle

        public Turtle(TurtleWindow w)
        Creates a new Turtle in the given TurtleWindow's world.

    • Method Detail

      • turn

        public void turn(double delta)
        Turns the Turtle anticlockwise by the given number of degrees.
        Parameters:
        delta - - number of degrees to turn. Can be negative, in which case Turtle will turn clockwise.

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double deg)
        Turns Turtle to the given angle, where 0 corresponds to east, 90 to north, 180 west and 270 south.
        Parameters:
        deg - the new angle to point.

      • move

        public void move(double dist)
        Moves this Turtle the given distance in the direction it is facing. If the pen is down it will draw a line between its starting and ending locations.
        Parameters:
        dist - the number of pixels to move

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(double x,
                   double y)
        Moves Turtle to the position given by parameters; if the pen is down, the Turtle will draw a line as it goes.
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate - double
        y - coordinate - double

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears all the drawing in the Turtle's world.

      • penUp

        public void penUp()
        Changes Turtle's pen to the up position (so no line will be drawn when it moves. Equivalent to calling setPenDown(false).
        See Also:
        penDown(), setPenDown(boolean)

      • penDown

        public void penDown()
        Changes Turtle's pen to the down position (so a line will be drawn when it moves. Equivalent to calling setPenDown(true).
        See Also:
        penUp(), setPenDown(boolean)

      • isDown

        public boolean isDown()
        Returns true if the Turtle's pen is currently down, false otherwise.

      • setPenDown

        public void setPenDown(boolean down)
        Sets the Turtle's pen position.
        Parameters:
        down - if true then pen will be put in down position; otherwise pen will be in up position.
        See Also:
        penUp(), penDown()

      • setColor

        public void setColor(java.awt.Color c)
        Sets the pen colour. Example usage:
         Turtle t = new Turtle();
 t.setColor(Color.blue);
        Requires that Color is imported, as in:
        import java.awt.Color;

      • center

        public void center()
        Moves Turtle to the middle of its world without drawing a line.

      • origin

        public void origin()
        Moves Turtle to the position 0,0 of its world (generally the bottom left) without drawing a line.

      • wait

        public void wait(int ms)
        Pauses for number of milliseconds indicated by parameter.

      • getColor

        public java.awt.Color getColor()
        Returns the currrent pen color
        Returns:
        pen's colour.

      • getX

        public double getX()
        Returns the Turtle's current x position.

      • getY

        public double getY()
        Returns the Turtle's current y position.

      • getDirection

        public double getDirection()
        Returns the Turtle's current direction (in degrees), where 0 corresponds to east, 90 to north, 180 to west and 270 to south.

      • setWorld

        public Turtle setWorld(TurtleWorld world)
        Sets the Turtle's world and returns a refeerence to this Turtle.
        Parameters:
        world - the new TurtleWorld
        Returns:
        this Turtle

      • getWorld

        public TurtleWorld getWorld()
        Returns this Turtle's world.

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Returns a clone of this Turtle. The new Turtle will share the same world as this one. Although the clone will also share the same pen colour object (initially), this is safe because Color is immutable. The result must be cast to Turtle to be used, as in:

         Turtle t = new Turtle();
 Turtle t2 = (Turtle) t.clone();
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
